com.compendium.core.datamodel
Class ExternalConnection

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.datamodel.PCObject
      com.compendium.core.datamodel.ExternalConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPCObject, ICoreConstants, java.io.Serializable
public class ExternalConnection
extends PCObject
implements java.io.Serializable

The ExternalConnection object represents a connection to a MySQL database, or Jabber Server, or such. This object must have its 'initialize' method called before it can read/write to the database. Otherwise it is just a container class.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary
protected  int nPort
          The port number to use.
protected  int nType
          int holding the connection type as listed in ICoreConstants, e.g. mysql, jabber etc.

          String holding the server login name.

          String holding the conection profile name
protected  java.lang.String sResource
          The resource for a Jabber connection.
protected  java.lang.String sServer
          Stirng holding the host name or ip address for the server.
protected  java.lang.String sUserID
          String holding the UserID who set up this connection

sServer

protected java.lang.String sServer
Stirng holding the host name or ip address for the server.

sLogin

protected java.lang.String sLogin
String holding the server login name.

sPassword

protected java.lang.String sPassword
String holding the server user password.

sName

protected java.lang.String sName
String holding various things depending on connection type. For MySQL, it holds the name of the default database. For Jabber it holds the user desired friendly name when seding messages.

nPort

protected int nPort
The port number to use.

sResource

protected java.lang.String sResource
The resource for a Jabber connection.
